name: LOINCChangeSet
title: Tinkar-compliant LOINC Change Set (CodeSystem)
publisher: HL7 International - Terminology Infrastructure Work Group
description: Profile of CodeSystem to enable lossless representation of LOINC change set compliant with Tinkar information model requirements. This profile is a specialization of the broader Tinker Terminology Change Set profile.

element.definition: This codes system profile contains the applicable subset of the LOINC codes used in the LIVD Catalog.

element.short: Total concepts in this changeset for the code system
element.definition: The total number of concepts defined in this change set for the code system.
element.comment: The count of concepts defined in this change set should match what is defined in the CodeSystem.content tree - included to assist with reconciliation of processing.
To cover through slices: Component, Property, Time, System, Scale, Method.

element.definition: Reference to the formal meaning of the property. One possible source of meaning is the [Concept Properties](codesystem-concept-properties.html) code system.

element.short: code | Coding | string | integer | boolean | dateTime
element.definition: The type of the property value. Properties of type "code" contain a code defined by the code system (e.g. a reference to anotherr defined concept).
Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meaning of the hierarchical relationships are.

element.comment: This contains the LOINC Long Name.

element.short: Additional information supplied about each concept
element.definition: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.
element.comment: To cover through slices: Component, Property, Time, System, Scale, Method.

element.short: Identifies the property on the concepts, and when referred to in operations
element.definition: A code that is used to identify the property. The code is used internally (in CodeSystem.concept.property.code) and also externally, such as in property filters.

element.short: Additional information supplied about each concept
